As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr(n).(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: A spaceship crashes on a desolate alien planet inhabited by nocturnal predators. The creatures' fear of light seems to guarantee the survivors' safety - but when an eclipse takes place, they face a desperate struggle to survive. Their only hope lies with a convicted murderer, who is equally at home in the darkness - but is far from trustworthy. Sci-fi horror, starring Vin Diesel and Radha Mitchell(n).(n)

programme.title: The Survivalist
programme.desc: A loner survives the downfall of civilisation, living in a remote cabin on a small plot of land. When two women discover his refuge, he grudgingly allows them food and shelter, but they struggle to trust one another, especially as the supplies begin to run out. Thriller, starring Martin McCann and Mia Goth(n).

programme.title: Honeytrap
programme.desc: A Brixton teenager's misguided attempts to attract the attention of a heartless wannabe rapper have terrible results. Drama, starring Jessica Sula, Lucien Laviscount and Ntonga Mwanza(n).

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara(n).

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer(n).

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen(n).

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: A faded film star from the silent-movie era is fixated with making a comeback. When she meets a struggling screenwriter on the run from debt collectors, she persuades him to write a script that will mark her spectacular return to the screen. However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim(n).

programme.title: The Sea Inside
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a fisherman who is paralysed from the neck down in a diving accident. After spending years dependent on others to take care of him, he decides to fight for the legal right to end his own life. Starring Javier Bardem, Belen Rueda and Lola Duenas. In Spanish, Catalan and Galician(n).

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A bored millionaire masterminds a bank robbery, only to find himself pursued by a glamorous insurance investigator determined to prove his guilt. It is not long before they get embroiled in a passionate affair - but conflicting interests mean they can never really trust one another. Crime drama, starring Steve McQueen, Faye Dunaway, Paul Burke and Yaphet Kotto(n).

programme.title: White Bird in a Blizzard
programme.desc: A teenager relishes her newfound freedom when her mother goes missing, seizing the opportunity to flirt with the boy next door and a cop on the case. Over time, she begins to realise what she has lost and finds the unexplained details of the disappearance haunting her. Mystery based on Laura Kasischke's novel, starring Shailene Woodley and Eva Green(n).

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: An awkward teenager shuns all kinds of social interaction, apart from making films with his best friend. His well-meaning mother urges him to spend time with a girl who has been diagnosed with leukaemia, and they unexpectedly develop a firm friendship. However, his life is changed forever as her condition gets worse. Comedy drama based on Jesse Andrews' novel, starring Thomas Mann, RJ Cyler and Olivia Cooke(n).

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangster's accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his boss's millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchie's crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton(n).

programme.title: Training Day
programme.desc: A cop embarks on his first day in narcotics, partnering a seasoned officer whose willingness to flout the rules forces him to question everything he has learnt. As they resort to extreme measures to crack a case, the rookie is left battling his conscience in a dangerous situation. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke, Scott Glenn and Tom Berenger(n).

programme.title: Quadrophenia
programme.desc: A teenager in 1960s London is unhappy with his lot in life, but believes he has found a place to belong in the mod subculture and their feud with the rival rockers. As the mods gather in Brighton for a weekend that turns to violence, his naive vision of the world is cruelly shattered. Drama based on the Who album, starring Phil Daniels, Leslie Ash, Sting and Ray Winstone(n).(n)

programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: A Confederate soldier refuses to surrender at the end of the Civil War, and is branded a dangerous outlaw. Crossing America in search of sanctuary from the army and bounty hunters, he only wants solitude - but ends up with a strange assortment of travelling companions. Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Chief Dan George and Sondra Locke(n).(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A bored millionaire masterminds a bank robbery, only to find himself pursued by a glamorous insurance investigator determined to prove his guilt. It is not long before they get embroiled in a passionate affair - but conflicting interests mean they can never really trust one another. Crime drama, starring Steve McQueen, Faye Dunaway, Paul Burke and Yaphet Kotto(n).(n)

programme.title: Northwest
programme.desc: A teenage burglar uses his ill-gotten gains to support his mother and younger brother. Longing for a more profitable line of work, he gets involved with a gangster, but soon he and his sibling are in over their heads as they are drawn into a world of drugs and prostitution. Crime drama, starring real-life brothers Gustav and Oscar Dyekjaer Giese. In Danish(n).(n)

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A husband and wife take a yachting trip to help recover from the death of their son. While out on the open water the couple spot a sinking ship and manage to save the only person left on board - but they come to bitterly regret their good deed when the situation turns dark and a fraught battle of wits ensues. Thriller, based on a novel by Charles Williams, with Sam Neill, Nicole Kidman and Billy Zane(n).(n)

programme.title: Sixteen
programme.desc: An African former child soldier now living in London tries to leave his violent past behind him as he approaches his 16th birthday, but when he witnesses a stabbing and the people involved want to make sure that he says nothing to the police, violence forces its way back into his life. Thriller, starring Roger Jean Nsengiyumva, Rachael Stirling and Rosie Day(n).(n)

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: A charming psychopath meets a tennis professional on a train and suggests that they each commit a murder on the other's behalf. However, when the deranged man goes through with his part of the deal, the sportsman faces a race against time to prove his innocence. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, starring Robert Walker, Farley Granger and Ruth Roman(n).(n)

programme.title: A Fistful of Dollars
programme.desc: A mysterious gunslinger rides into a town on the Mexican border divided by two warring families. After killing the henchmen of one clan, he seems to have made it clear where his loyalties lie and is hired by their rivals. However, he is secretly planning to play them off against each other to his own advantage. Sergio Leone's Western, with Clint Eastwood making his first appearance as The Man with No Name alongside Gian Maria Volonte and Marianne Koch(n).(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski(n).(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone(n).(n)

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: In 1965, amidst an atmosphere of racial unrest, civil rights campaigner Dr Martin Luther King Jr plans a peaceful march across Alabama from Selma to Montgomery. His goal is to persuade President Lyndon B Johnson to change the law, allowing black people to register to vote. Fact-based drama, starring David Oyelowo, Tom Wilkinson and Carmen Ejogo(n).(n)

programme.title: Amistad
programme.desc: African slaves seize control of the vessel transporting them to Spain in 1839. Two surviving Spanish crewmen steer the ship to America, where the slaves are imprisoned for killing their captors - but an abolitionist lawyer argues the case for granting them their freedom. Steven Spielberg's historical drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Morgan Freeman, Matthew McConaughey, Djimon Hounsou, Nigel Hawthorne and Pete Postlethwaite(n).(n)

programme.title: Neighbouring Sounds
programme.desc: A private security firm is hired to safeguard a middle-class neighbourhood in Brazil, leaving the residents with mixed feelings about their new protectors. Meanwhile, one woman is more concerned with the constant barking of her neighbour's dog. Drama, starring Maeve Jinkings and Ana Rita Gurgel. In Portuguese, English, Mandarin and Persian(n).

programme.title: Forty Guns
programme.desc: A despotic Arizona landowner, who uses a band of hired gunmen to dominate her territory, becomes attracted to a determined US marshal sent to restore order. The lawman has renounced violence, but when tragedy strikes on the day of his wedding, he takes up arms once again. Western, starring Barbara Stanwyck, with Barry O'Sullivan and Dean Jagger(n).

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern(n).

programme.title: Genevieve
programme.desc: Two rival motoring enthusiasts engage in a friendly race on the way back from the London-to-Brighton veteran car rally. However, their light-hearted attitude turns into heated competition as they approach the finishing line, with their friendship seemingly doomed - while their long-suffering other halves have to contend with their obsession. Comedy, starring Dinah Sheridan, John Gregson, Kenneth More and Kay Kendall(n).

programme.title: Earthquake
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a catastrophic earthquake in Los Angeles, an architect helping in the rescue effort searches the smouldering ruins for his missing wife. Meanwhile, other residents, including an insubordinate cop, a lecherous shopkeeper and a daredevil motorcyclist, face their own battles for survival. Disaster movie, starring Charlton Heston, Ava Gardner, Genevieve Bujold, Richard Roundtree and George Kennedy(n).

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: A teenager falls in love with a new girl in his school, only to discover she is a witch. As dark secrets from her family's past emerge, they discover that on her 16th birthday, she will be required to choose a side in a conflict between good and evil. Fantasy based on Kami Garcia's novel, starring Alden Ehrenreich, Alice Englert, Jeremy Irons and Emma Thompson(n).

programme.title: Pitch Perfect
programme.desc: A new student finds herself a social outcast during her first year of college, but soon acquires a new circle of friends in a band of misfits with a shared talent for singing. She joins their a cappella group and leads them to compete in the campus music competitions. Comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Elizabeth Banks(n).

programme.title: Law Abiding Citizen
programme.desc: A man is forced to witness the murder of his wife and daughter, and is driven to despair when one of the perpetrators walks free at trial. Years later, he begins a campaign of vigilante violence, seeking revenge on the killers and the justice system that failed to punish them, particularly an assistant district attorney who allowed the defendant to make a deal during the court proceedings. Thriller, with Gerard Butler and Jamie Foxx(n).

programme.title: The Kings of Summer
programme.desc: Three teenagers tire of abiding by their parents' rules, so decide to build their own house deep in a forest where they can live free of any outside authority. Their idyllic summer puts their friendship to the test as they learn that freedom comes at a cost. Comedy drama, starring Nick Robinson, Gabriel Basso and Moises Arias(n).(n)

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: A socially inept high-school student and his lonely unemployed brother find their eccentric home life thrown into upheaval when their meddling uncle comes to stay. The teenage oddball tries to make the best of his changing circumstances, while putting all his skills to the task of helping his new best friend win the class presidency. Comedy, starring Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez and Haylie Duff(n).(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters
programme.desc: The modern-day teenage son of the Greek god Poseidon must lead his friends on a perilous journey into the Bermuda triangle. They need to recover the legendary Golden Fleece to save the world, but getting to it means braving all manner of terrifying monsters. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Logan Lerman and Alexandra Daddario(n).(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang(n).(n)

programme.title: Seven Years in Tibet
programme.desc: An arrogant Austrian mountaineer tries to become the first to conquer a peak in India that has claimed the lives of 11 previous climbers. However, the outbreak of the Second World War leaves him languishing in a PoW camp. He escapes and ends up in the holy city of Lhasa, where he befriends the 14-year-old Dalai Lama and learns the meaning of inner peace. Fact-based drama, starring Brad Pitt, David Thewlis and BD Wong(n).(n)

programme.title: Ted
programme.desc: A lonely boy makes a wish at Christmas that his teddy bear will come to life, which is magically granted. The boy grows up to become a directionless slacker, with the foul-mouthed living toy still his inseparable friend - but his girlfriend thinks it is time for him to grow up. Comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg and Mila Kunis, directed by and featuring the voice of Seth MacFarlane(n).(n)

programme.title: Warm Bodies
programme.desc: A zombie has an unusual reaction to eating a man's brain - he begins to fall in love with his victim's girlfriend. As he regains his human feelings, he forms a close connection with the living woman of his dreams, but their relationship is threatened by both the other walking dead and her militaristic father. Romantic comedy horror, with Nicholas Hoult, Teresa Palmer and John Malkovich(n).(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy's new part-time job hurtles him into the throes of an emotional battle raging in the heart of a hostile young blind woman(n).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John complains that his life is dwindling away before his eyes, so decides to leave home and embark on an adventure(n).

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The students are set the task of tracing their family trees for a school assignment, but Albert doesn't know where to begin - so Charles and Caroline decide to make matters easier by adopting him. Michael Pataki guest stars(n).

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Adam and Mary take a trip to the city to collect an award he has won, but their journey proves eventful for all the wrong reasons when their coach overturns. Mary must deliver the baby of a pregnant fellow passenger, while Adam remains trapped under the wreckage. Drama, starring Melissa Sue Anderson(n).

programme.title: James Dean
programme.desc: Biopic of the influential but short-lived movie star, based on the writings of his friend and fellow actor William Bast. Starring Stephen McHattie, Michael Brandon and Brooke Adams(n).

programme.title: The Christmas List
programme.desc: A shop assistant is frustrated at her lack of success at work and fed up with her boyfriend taking her for granted. She writes a list of the things she wants out of life, which ends up in the shop's mailbox for children's letters to Santa. Magically, her wishes start coming true, but not always in the way she hoped. Fantasy drama, starring Mimi Rogers, Rob Stewart and Stella Stevens(n).

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: An upper-class youngster befriends an eccentric 80-year-old vagrant, who takes him on a journey into an America he never knew existed, where poverty, degradation and despair are commonplace. Drama, with Fred Savage, Hume Cronyn, Jim Byrnes, Kenneth Welsh and Badja Djola(n).

programme.title: The Christmas Shoes
programme.desc: A little boy is determined to do whatever he can to buy his dying mother a pair of expensive red shoes. Along the way, his tireless efforts inspire an amazing transformation in the life of a cold-hearted lawyer struggling to cope with the slow disintegration of his marriage. Festive family drama, starring Rob Lowe, Maria Del Mar, Max Morrow and Kimberly Williams(n).

programme.title: Santa and Pete
programme.desc: A widower worries about facing his first Christmas since his wife died, but finds comfort in telling his 10-year-old grandson a traditional Dutch tale about Father Christmas's amazing travels, including an occasion when the jolly old fellow needed help from a kindly cook. Children's fantasy, starring James Earl Jones, Hume Cronyn, Flex Alexander, Tempestt Bledsoe, Emily Mae Young and Sedrathe Gillespie(n).

programme.title: 3 Holiday Tails
programme.desc: A married couple retire to Florida with their golden retriever, and befriend their neighbour and her three puppies. When they discover that their new friend's lost love is about to marry someone else, they plot to bring them back together - with the help of the dogs. Romantic comedy sequel to A Golden Christmas, with Julie Gonzalo, KC Clyde, Bruce Davison and Alley Mills(n).

programme.title: A Golden Christmas
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts bury a time capsule, with the help of their beloved dog. As adults, they both return to their home town looking for a fresh start and, not recognising one another, fall into an instant mutual dislike. It falls to another dog to remind them of the past and bring them back together. Romantic comedy, with Andrea Roth and Nicholas Brendon(n).

programme.title: Must Be Santa
programme.desc: Father Christmas plans to retire after a lifetime of sterling service, but his replacement proves to be something of a surprise and has a hard time living up to his predecessor's expectations. Festive comedy, starring Dabney Coleman, Deanna Milligan and Arnold Pinnock(n).

programme.title: The Christmas Star
programme.desc: A con man dresses up as Santa Claus to break out of jail and recover his hidden stash of stolen loot. However, his perfect little plan is thrown into chaos after he's mistaken for the genuine article by two inquisitive kids - who end up making life very difficult indeed. Disney fantasy comedy, starring Ed Asner, Fred Gwynne, Rene Auberjonois and Susan Tyrrell(n).

programme.title: The Christmas Choir
programme.desc: A workaholic accountant is forced to reassess his priorities after his devotion to his job costs him his girlfriend. An encounter with a homeless pianist reminds him of his forgotten dream of becoming a musician, so he decides to help the residents of a homeless shelter earn some money by forming a choir. Drama, starring Jason Gedrick and Tyrone Benskin(n).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: An old friend of the family turns up on Walton's Mountain, but it soon transpires that he has an ulterior motive for paying them a visit(n).(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa gives the family cause for concern when he suffers a heart attack(n).(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nels becomes apprehensive when he learns that a travelling circus, in which his estranged sister Annabelle is one of the stars, is coming to Walnut Grove. Drama, starring Richard Bull(n).(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mrs Oleson is shocked to discover a woman has spent the night in the Rev Alden's room and wastes no time in setting out to have him expelled from the Church(n).(n)

programme.title: Must Be Santa
programme.desc: Father Christmas plans to retire after a lifetime of sterling service, but his replacement proves to be something of a surprise and has a hard time living up to his predecessor's expectations. Festive comedy, starring Dabney Coleman, Deanna Milligan and Arnold Pinnock(n).(n)

programme.title: A Golden Christmas

As adults, they both return to their home town looking for a fresh start and, not recognising one another, fall into an instant mutual dislike. It falls to another dog to remind them of the past and bring them back together. Romantic comedy, with Andrea Roth and Nicholas Brendon(n).(n)

programme.title: Our Gift of Love
programme.desc: A freak accident leaves a man in a coma shortly before Christmas. While friends and family urge his wife to prepare for the worst, she refuses to accept he will not recover and dedicates herself to taking care of him. Drama, starring Rebecca De Mornay, Henry Czerny, Barclay Hope and Lila Yee(n).(n)

programme.title: A Christmas Snow
programme.desc: A woman refuses to celebrate Christmas, because of her father abandoning his family during the holiday. When a fierce blizzard strikes her town in the run-up to the big day, she is forced to give shelter to two strangers, and as she gets to know them, she begins to rethink her bitter outlook on life. Festive drama, starring Catherine Mary Stewart and Muse Watson(n).(n)

programme.title: Stealing Christmas
programme.desc: A fugitive lies low in a small town, where he starts to plan his next job on the local bank. However, as he gets involved in the everyday life of the community - even playing Santa for the children - he is dogged by doubts and second thoughts as he reflects on how warmly the residents have welcomed him. Crime comedy, starring Tony Danza, Lea Thompson and Betty White(n).(n)

programme.title: I'll Be Home for Christmas
programme.desc: A couple in a small New England town during the Second World War await the return of their two sons and daughter for Christmas. Drama, starring Hal Holbrook, Eva Marie Saint, Jason Oliver, Courteney Cox, Peter Gallagher and Nancy Travis(n).(n)

programme.title: The Christmas Tree
programme.desc: Heart-warming festive drama, starring Andrew McCarthy as a gardener who strikes up an unlikely friendship with a nun while wrangling over the fate of an endangered fir tree, and learns the true meaning of Christmas. Trini Alvarado also stars in Sally Field's directorial debut(n).(n)

programme.title: Santa and Pete

Children's fantasy, starring James Earl Jones, Hume Cronyn, Flex Alexander, Tempestt Bledsoe, Emily Mae Young and Sedrathe Gillespie(n).(n)

programme.title: A Song for the Season
programme.desc: An inspirational music teacher throws herself into preparing her students for a tuneful extravaganza. However, she remains blissfully unaware that the school is in financial difficulty and plan to close the music department. A dour administrator is sent to oversee the school's fate, only to face a crisis of conscience when he falls for the teacher. Romantic drama, starring Naomi Judd, Gerald McRaney and Alison Pill(n).(n)

programme.title: The Christmas Shoes
programme.desc: A little boy is determined to do whatever he can to buy his dying mother a pair of expensive red shoes. Along the way, his tireless efforts inspire an amazing transformation in the life of a cold-hearted lawyer struggling to cope with the slow disintegration of his marriage. Festive family drama, starring Rob Lowe, Maria Del Mar, Max Morrow and Kimberly Williams(n).(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.sub-title: One Fresh Batch of Lemonade - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jonathan enlists the aid of a gymnast in restoring Deke's faith in himself, and also tries to reconcile the former athlete with his father(n).

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan helps a man who thinks he is King Arthur to make peace with the son who wants to have him committed, while also trying to save a veterinary clinic. Ron Moody guest stars(n).

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: The angels help a feuding mother and daughter rebuild their relationship. Drama, starring Roma Downey and Della Reese(n).

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Tess and Monica help a man distinguish between his material desires from his love of family. Roma Downey and Della Reese star(n).

programme.title: The Price of a Broken Heart
programme.desc: A woman learns her husband has been having an affair with his secretary for years and plans to abandon his family for her. The spurned wife responds by suing her husband's lover for $1million under a long-forgotten state law - resulting in a case that has far-reaching consequences for American divorce law. Fact-based drama, starring Laura Innes, Park Overall and Timothy Carhart(n).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family offers the new minister a place to stay, and Elizabeth falls in love with him. Erin offers to help the Baldwin sisters write their memoirs(n).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason wrestles with the morality of war as he decides whether to enlist in the army, while Jim Bob is desperate to join up despite being too young(n).

programme.title: Birth of the Beatles

programme.title: Taming Andrew
programme.desc: A mother is distraught when her son is abducted and spends the next five years searching for him, only to suffer more pain when they are finally reunited and she discovers the emotional trauma he has endured. Fact-based drama, starring Park Overall, Jason Beghe and Seth Adkins(n).

programme.title: Her Desperate Choice
programme.desc: A woman flees the authorities in an attempt to protect her daughter from the child's paedophile father and seeks the help of an underground organisation dedicated to protecting abused youngsters. Drama, with Kyle Secor, Faith Ford, Hanna R Hall and Nigel Bennett(n).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The pressures of the war and changing values begin to affecting John, who considers giving up the lumber mill(n).

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: At the End of the Rainbow.
programme.desc: Laura and her friend Jonah find pyrite while fishing in a stream, and mistake it for gold. Laura spends her days amassing the `gold dust', and begins fantasising about her family being wealthy and the Olesons being poor. However the secrecy leads to squabbling(n).

programme.title: The Outsider
programme.desc: Love story focusing on the relationship which grows between a young widow from a religious group and a cold-blooded gunslinger whom she takes into her home after he is wounded. Romantic Western, starring Naomi Watts, Thomas Curtis, David Carradine and Timothy Daly(n).

programme.title: Sudden Fury
programme.desc: Three abused brothers are suspected of complicity in the murder of their callous adoptive parents. Fact-based drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Johnny Galecki, Gregory Harrison and Linda Kelsey(n).

programme.title: Freshman Fall
programme.desc: A student is raped while drunk at her brother's fraternity party, and tries to find a way to bring her attacker to justice. Drama, with Candace Cameron Bure, Mark-Paul Gosselaar and Bess Armstrong(n).

programme.title: In the Line of Duty: The Price of Vengeance
programme.desc: A tough-talking hitman sets out to bump off a quartet of local businessman who stand in his way - but he decides to do away with a hard-nosed cop into the bargain, a decision that makes him the target of a furious vendetta. Crime thriller, starring Dean Stockwell, Michael Gross and Brent Jennings(n).

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark are hired to look after the children of a movie star who has little time for his family(n).(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of a scriptwriter, who needs help funding a movie(n).(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica's rival the dark angel Kathleen tricks her into missing a performance evaluation. James Earl Jones guest stars(n).(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica reveals herself to a church Pastor, who tries to take his anger out on God after the death of his son in a car accident. Drama, starring Roma Downey(n).(n)

programme.title: Terror in the Shadows
programme.desc: A man's idyllic family life is shattered by the revelation that the deranged killer of his first wife has escaped from a mental institution and is out for revenge. Thriller, starring Genie Francis, Leigh J McCloskey and Victoria Wyndham(n).(n)

programme.title: A Golden Christmas

programme.desc: Brilliant and obese scientist Sherman Klump invents a miraculous weight-loss solution. programme.title: Diary of a Mad Black Woman

When Grace leaves for a gathering at her parents' swanky compound, he hatches a plan to crash the assemblage, charm her folks, and slip a ring on her finger.
